name: Ajax Security Team
descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) is a group that has been active since at least 2010 and believed to be operating out of Iran. By 2014 [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) transitioned from website defacement operations to malware-based cyber espionage campaigns targeting the US defense industrial base and Iranian users of anti-censorship technologies.(Citation: FireEye Operation Saffron Rose 2013)

subtechniques.name: Credentials from Web Browsers
subtechniques.descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) has used FireMalv custom-developed malware, which collected passwords from the Firefox browser storage.(Citation: Check Point Rocket Kitten)

technique_table_data.name: Ingress Tool Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) has used Wrapper/Gholee, custom-developed malware, which downloaded additional malware to the infected system.(Citation: Check Point Rocket Kitten)

subtechniques.name: Keylogging
subtechniques.descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) has used CWoolger and MPK, custom-developed malware, which recorded all keystrokes on an infected system.(Citation: Check Point Rocket Kitten)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) has used personalized spearphishing attachments.(Citation: Check Point Rocket Kitten)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing via Service
subtechniques.descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) has used various social media channels to spearphish victims.(Citation: FireEye Operation Saffron Rose 2013)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) has lured victims into executing malicious files.(Citation: FireEye Operation Saffron Rose 2013)

alias_descriptions.name: Operation Woolen-Goldfish
alias_descriptions.descr: Analysis of infrastructure, tools, and modes of operation revealed a potential relationship between [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) and the campaign Operation Woolen-Goldfish.(Citation: Check Point Rocket Kitten)(Citation: TrendMicro Operation Woolen Goldfish March 2015)

alias_descriptions.name: Rocket Kitten
alias_descriptions.descr: Analysis of infrastructure, tools, and modes of operation revealed a potential relationship between [Ajax Security Team](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0130) and Rocket Kitten.(Citation: Check Point Rocket Kitten)(Citation: IranThreats Kittens Dec 2017)

TrendMicro Operation Woolen Goldfish Mar.description: Cedric Pernet, Kenney Lu. (2015, March 19). Operation Woolen-Goldfish - When Kittens Go phishing. Retrieved April 21, 2021.

Check Point Rocket Kitten.description: Check Point Software Technologies. (2015). ROCKET KITTEN: A CAMPAIGN WITH 9 LIVES. Retrieved March 16, 2018.

CrowdStrike Flying Kitten.description: Dahl, M.. (2014, May 13). Cat Scratch Fever: CrowdStrike Tracks Newly Reported Iranian Actor as FLYING KITTEN. Retrieved May 27, 2020.

IranThreats Kittens Dec 2017.description: Iran Threats . (2017, December 5). Flying Kitten to Rocket Kitten, A Case of Ambiguity and Shared Code. Retrieved May 28, 2020.

FireEye Operation Saffron Rose 2013.description: Villeneuve, N. et al.. (2013). OPERATION SAFFRON ROSE . Retrieved May 28, 2020.
